IRndrGeneric Interface Reference
[RNDR+ Module]

import "rndrplus.idl";

Inheritance diagram for IRndrGeneric:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The Generic Renderer.

The generic renderer with minimal functionality necessary to render SCENE+ objects.

See also:
IRenderer - a fully functional renderer interface.

Definition at line 110 of file rndrplus.idl.

Public Member Functions

Device-Compatible Buffers
These functions provide the device-compatible IMeshVertexBuffer and IMeshFaceBuffer buffers.

Remarks:
  • This should be the only way in which the objects of these classes are constructed.
  • You are required to perform second-stage creation (see IMeshVertexBuffer::Create and IMeshFaceBuffer::Create).
  • You are not required to call CreateBuffers prior to GetBuffers, the latter will create them if necessary
  • Subsequent calls to GetBuffers will return the same objects, call CreateBuffers to re-create them


HRESULT GetBuffers ([out] IMeshVertexBuffer **,[out] IMeshFaceBuffer **)
 Provides device-compatible buffers; creates new if necessary.

HRESULT CreateBuffers (BOOL bVertexBuf, BOOL bFaceBuf)
 Replaces requested buffers with the new ones.

Display and Viewport Information
HRESULT GetTargetSize (FWULONG *pX, FWULONG *pY)
 Returns the size of the current target rendering device, which may be window, full screen or offscreen buffer.

HRESULT GetBackBufferSize (FWULONG *pX, FWULONG *pY)
 Returns the size of the current back buffer.

HRESULT GetViewSize (FWULONG *pX, FWULONG *pY)
 Deprecated, use GetTargetSize instead.

HRESULT GetViewport ([out] FWULONG *pX,[out] FWULONG *pY,[out] FWULONG *pWidth,[out] FWULONG *pHeight)
 Returns current viewport position and size, in the backbuffer coordinates (the actual viewport is rescaled to fit the currently used display).

HRESULT GetTargetViewport ([out] FWULONG *pX,[out] FWULONG *pY,[out] FWULONG *pWidth,[out] FWULONG *pHeight)
 Returns current viewport position and size, in the target device coordinates.

HRESULT GetAspectRatio (FWFLOAT *)
 returns the aspect ratio of the target viewport

HRESULT PutViewport (FWFLOAT fX, FWFLOAT fY, FWFLOAT fWidth, FWFLOAT fHeight, FWLONG nX, FWLONG nY, FWLONG nWidth, FWLONG nHeight)
 Sets viewport data (more).

HRESULT PutTargetViewport (FWFLOAT fX, FWFLOAT fY, FWFLOAT fWidth, FWFLOAT fHeight, FWLONG nX, FWLONG nY, FWLONG nWidth, FWLONG nHeight)
 Sets viewport data using target display coordinates rather than back buffer (see IRndrGeneric::PutViewport).

Rendering
HRESULT GetResetFlag ([out, retval] BOOL *bReset)
 returns true after the device reset - enforces cameras, lights etc. to render

Rendering
HRESULT RenderMesh (struct RNDR_MESHEDOBJ *)
 Renders the mesh data provided by ISceneObject (see ISceneRenderee::Render, RNDR_MESHEDOBJ).

The Lighting

HRESULT SetDirLight (FWULONG iIndex, FWCOLOR clrDiff, FWCOLOR clrSpec, FWCOLOR clrAmb, FWVECTOR *pDir)
HRESULT SetSpotLight (FWULONG iIndex, FWCOLOR clrDiff, FWCOLOR clrSpec, FWCOLOR clrAmb, FWVECTOR *pPos, FWVECTOR *pDir, FWFLOAT fTheta, FWFLOAT fPhi, FWFLOAT fFalloff)
HRESULT SetAmbientLight (FWCOLOR clrAmb)
View and Projection Transforms (Camera Rendering)
These functions provide the device-compatible IMeshVertexBuffer and IMeshFaceBuffer buffers.

Remarks:
  • This should be the only way in which the objects of these classes are constructed.
  • You are required to perform second-stage creation (see IMeshVertexBuffer::Create and IMeshFaceBuffer::Create).
  • You are not required to call CreateBuffers prior to GetBuffers, the latter will create them if necessary
  • Subsequent calls to GetBuffers will return the same objects, call CreateBuffers to re-create them


HRESULT GetViewTransform ([out, retval] ITransform **pVal)
 Gets the view transformation.

HRESULT PutViewTransform ([in] ITransform *newVal)
 Puts the view transformation.

HRESULT GetProjectionTransform ([out, retval] ITransform **pVal)
 Gets the projection transformation.

HRESULT PutProjectionTransform ([in] ITransform *newVal)
 Puts the projection transformation.

HRESULT CreateTexture ([out, retval] ITexture **ppTexture)

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT IRndrGeneric::PutViewport (  FWFLOAT  fX,
FWFLOAT  fY,
FWFLOAT  fWidth,
FWFLOAT  fHeight,
FWLONG  nX,
FWLONG  nY,
FWLONG  nWidth,
FWLONG  nHeight
) 
 

Sets viewport data (more).

Sets position and size of the viewport using the back buffer coordinate system. Use fX, fY, fWidth abd fHeight to define the viewport as a fraction of entire buffer. Use nX, nY, nWidth and nHeight to add an extra offset in pixels. Example: PutViewport(0.5, 0, 0.5, 0.5, 5, 5, -10, -10) creates a viewport in upper-right quarter of the back buffer, with a frame 5-pixel wide along all four edges
